Description: Handle of Rhodian pottery transport amphora; sharp turn; rectangular stamp with caduceus symbol; clay relatively fine, fine pores, small mica, yellow lime inclusions, sandy feel, beige to orange.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.0974)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: 2002.87 (Former Incorrect MFA accession No.)
Miscellaneous number: Cls.Inv.27 (Former MFA FIC/INV No.)
Miscellaneous number: P.5816 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
